description: Unique identifier for the request compensation change for employee(s).

Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

Request_Compensation_Change_Request_HV.description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.

validation.validation: The job is not valid for the employee.
validation.description: The job is not valid for the employee.

validation.validation: The employee you have selected has more than one job. You must supply the job to which this operation applies.
validation.description: The employee you have selected has more than one job. You must supply the job to which this operation applies.

validation.validation: Position submitted is not filled as of the effective date.
validation.description: Position submitted is not filled as of the effective date.

validation.validation: There is another pending compensation process for position [position].

You can't complete this transaction because the worker is included in an in-progress compensation review process. You can remove the worker from the compensation review process, then complete the transaction, and optionally add the worker back to the compensation review process.

validation.validation: Compensation Change cannot take place before Employee Hire Date or after Employee Termination date
validation.description: Compensation Change cannot take place before Employee Hire Date or after Employee Termination date

Request_Compensation_Change_Data.description: False by default. If True, the compensation change date defaults to the start of the next payroll period.

validation.validation: A payroll period start date can not be found for the employee.  Configure payroll periods or provide a specific compensation change date.

Request_Compensation_Change_Data.description: Date the employee can view their compensation change.  Employee Visibility Date must be enabled on the Edit Tenant Setup - HCM task.

validation.validation: The Employee Visibility Date has been set to a value, but the Employee Visibility Feature has not been activated in the HCM Tenant settings. Please leave the date blank or activate the feature in the tenant level settings.
The Employee Visibility Date must be on or after the Effective Date.

Compensation_Change_Data.description: This field allows you to override the amount calculated for plan assignments for a worker managed by compensation basis.

validation.validation: Override Compensation Basis Calculation is not a valid field for worker [worker] because the worker is not managed by compensation basis.

Override Compensation Basis Calculation is not a valid field when the field Primary Compensation Basis, Primary Compensation Basis Amount Change, or Primary Compensation Basis Percent Change is specified.

Compensation_Change_Data.description: Sum of the employee's plan assignments as defined by their primary compensation basis.
Amount you can change the primary compensation basis for employees managed by basis total. Mutually exclusive from the percent.
Percent you can change the primary compensation basis for employees managed by a compensation basis. Mutually exclusive from the amount.
